translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions for Phenomena

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽19.9. Dassanahetuttika🔽Nadassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  dassana hetuttika  na dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Section on the Triads🔽With non-visible cause as condition there arises a phenomenon with visible cause as its condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā chabbīsa, ārammaṇe ekavīsa, adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate chabbīsa.
analyzed: hetuyā chabbīsa ārammaṇe ekavīsa adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate chabbīsa
translated: With respect to cause, there are twenty-six; with respect to object, twenty-one; with respect to predominance, eighteen. … With respect to result, there are three. … With respect to non-hindrance, there are twenty-six.
